channel.title: AMD Tanking?
channel.description:
When will AMD actually make money again? The question is becoming more important by the day since it carries over $5 billion in long-term debt. After losing almost $3 billion from 2007 – 2008, analysts expect the company to lose more money in 2009 and 2010. While the shares rallied from their February $2 low, they still appear stuck in a long-term down trend from $40 highs way back in 2006. MC/EV=55%
Sauce: (look at #8) [code]http://finance.yahoo.com/tech-ticker/article/336235/Ten-Big-Companies-That-Are-Veering-Toward-Bankruptcy?tickers=AMD,LVS,S,M,GT,MYL,HTZ[/code] If they go bankrupt, I will enjoying purchasing bulk AMD mobos/procs with the liquidation sale; but, I am leery of Intel creating unfair prices due to the lack of competition.

item.title: AMD Tanking?
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Since AMD or any other company in AMD’s position has lost billions of dollars in previous years and are losing even more now, I see no way up but rather down into the zone of bankruptcy.

Read full topic

item.title: AMD Tanking?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

right now AMD are doing well selling their processors, ATI are doing very well on their technology & sales. AMD though won’t progress much further with their current CPU technology, they need to create something more powerful cause theres only so much the Phenom II X4’s can go.

Read full topic

item.title: AMD Tanking?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I thought the whole Nahalem architecture was a brilliant move by Intel, the i7 and i5 chips are fantastic.

Read full topic

item.title: AMD Tanking?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:11, topic:306400”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=402554.msg2983170#msg2983170 date=1254757043]
If AMD go bankrupt, VIA will probably start making more powerful CPU’s and become Intel’s main competitor but it is likely the high-end market will become Intel dominated. It will be really bad because then Intel will not be motivated at all and wont bother to make as much development as they do now.

I think AMD will die but they will sell off the ATI division first.
[/quote]The cpu development is going in a completely wrong direction anyway.[/quote]
needs maor cores!

And yes, AMD as a whole (meaning ATI is included) is suffering major losses.

Read full topic

item.title: AMD Tanking?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If AMD go bankrupt, VIA will probably start making more powerful CPU’s and become Intel’s main competitor but it is likely the high-end market will become Intel dominated. It will be really bad because then Intel will not be motivated at all and wont bother to make as much development as they do now.

I think AMD will die but they will sell off the ATI division first.

item.title: AMD Tanking?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well the new ATI cards seem to be doing really well at the moment and i can see the 5850 becoming one of the most popular cards of this generation due to its fantastic value and performance.

So lets hope AMD don’t go bankrupt, because even if you don’t like them - a world with only Intel and Nvidia is not a good one.

Read full topic
